![Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|â€¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
â€¢ For more info: +82-33-250-3089| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [â˜ï¸+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) - [ğŸ tour.chuncheon.go.kr](http://tour.chuncheon.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8800481627 longitude: 127.7275492614 title: 55, Jungang-ro, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take bus 7, 9, 64, or 64-2 across from Chuncheon Intercity Bus Terminal.
Get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

[Subway]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line)
Take bus 63 and get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

data.title: Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)
data.description: The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Isabu Lion Park & Picture Book Land (ì´ì‚¬ë¶€ì‚¬ìê³µì›&ê·¸ë¦¼ì±… ë‚˜ë¼)
dataList.description: Isabu Lion Park & Picture Book Land is a family-friendly theme park that provides the beautiful ocean view of the East Sea up close. The park is open year round, serving as a perfect picnic park from spring to fall, while turning into a snowy fun park with a sledding hill in winter. The park also holds movie nights from time to time.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Inje Hwangtae Village (ì¸ì œ í™©íƒœë§ˆì„)
dataList.description:
Inje Hwangtae Village, with its excellent winter landscape, is known for its dried hwangtae (pollack), which repeatedly thaws and freezes with the fluctuations in the weather, giving it a delicious, chewy texture. Covered with snow, the area is worth visiting in the winter to enjoy all it has to offer. While walking around the site, visitors will be able to listen to the story of its background, and how myeongtae becomes hwangtae (dried pollack) after passing through the hands of thirty one people.

Nearby is Maebawi Rock, which has a metal path perfect for beginners, and it is also visited by advanced climbers for ice climbing in the winter months.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hyoseok Culture Village Buckwheat Food Street (íš¨ì„ë¬¸í™”ë§ˆì„ ë©”ë°€ìŒì‹ê±°ë¦¬)
dataList.description: The Hyoseok Culture Village is the place where author Lee Hyo-seok (penname â€œGasanâ€) was born and raised. The village is also the setting of the authorâ€™s story When Buckwheat Flowers Bloom,â€ one of the most celebrated Korean short stories to date. Since 1999, the Hyoseok Cultural Festival has been held here every September to commemorate the writer. Visitors to the festival can enjoy various foods and events as well as a replica of scenes from the book. For those that are searching for a more tranquil visit, avoid the month of September, when the buckwheat flowers are in full bloom. Dont forget to try all the different memil (buckwheat) dishes offered throughout the area all year round.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hwanseongul Cave  (Daei-ri Cave System) (í™˜ì„ êµ´ (ëŒ€ì´ë¦¬ ë™êµ´ì§€ëŒ€))
dataList.description: Hwanseongul Cave is the largest limestone cave in Asia, formed estimated 530 million years ago. The cafe features fantastic rocks in various shapes, stalagmites, and stalactites. There have been 47 new breeds of animals discovered in Hwanseongul Cave, with four of these being found to only live in this cave. In April 2010, a monorail was installed within the cave to make it more convenient for people to see all the natural habitat.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hwangji Pond (í™©ì§€ì—°ëª»)
dataList.description: Hwangji Pond, located in downtown Taebaek, is a source of the Nakdonggang River, flowing all the way to the Yeongnam Plain. The pond is divided into three sections  Sangji, with a diameter of 100 meters, Jungji and Haji. Although it is small in size, the pond supplies 5,000 tons of water a day.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hwajinpo Lake (í™”ì§„í¬(í™”ì§„í¬í˜¸))
dataList.description: Hwajinpo Lake is the largest lagoon in Korea with its sand made from seashells and rocks that were broken down over thousands of years. With soft sand and shallow waters, it is a popular beach location. In winter, various migratory birds and swans can be seen, as the birds enjoy clean water and food from the field of reeds. Because of its excellent scenery, Kim Il-seong of North Korea and the former South Korean President Rhee Syngman and Vice-president Lee Ki-poong had summer houses here. It also has Hwajinpo Museum of History with more than 40,000 artifacts from 1,500 species.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hwajinpo Beach [National Geopark] (í™”ì§„í¬ (ê°•ì›í‰í™”ì§€ì—­ êµ­ê°€ì§€ì§ˆê³µì›))
dataList.description: Hwajinpo Lake is the largest lagoon in Korea, created by a section of the ocean being closed off when two opposing sand spits merged. This unique formation and the ecosystem that came to live on the sand bar are highly valued. The water in the lagoon was a mix of fresh and salt water, creating a special environment for aquatic animals of both types to live together. The lake is in the shape of a figure eight, with the southern lake being larger than the northern lake, although the northern lake is still connected with the ocean through a small stream.
dataList.author: korea-tour
